text: I know that I probably won't see 90 and
I probably won't see Eddie but but who
knows how long the future will be but
none of us know that and so you just
enjoy and live every day as much as you
can that's life you know joy your life
of you but you said just brought me back
in a part of this you think about the
past a little bit but my name is Bob and
ma che and I'm the president and CEO of
AIG well I actually spent seven years as
a coca-cola truck driver and salesman
and put myself through prep school put
myself through college all the way up
into when I went into the United States
Army so I actually started out as just
plain worker and when I came out of the
army I was a lieutenant in the Signal
Corps in the 66 to 68 period of time and
from there I decided that the best thing
I could do to be successful was learn
about computers so I programmed my first
computer in 1964 I hate to admit it it's
a while ago and stayed in a technology
career and eventually worked my way
through marketing and eventually into
executive management
as I looked out at the Adriatic Sea
because I was in Croatia at the time as
you know for the summers and I looked at
the beauty and I thought about how good
my life was at that point in time and I
said why would I want to go back and
give this up and and it became clear as
the summer went on that AIG really
represented a very important part of the
financial world and they were totally
demoralized you had situations where
people's children were beat up in school
because their parent worked for AIG and
so what I realized was if I don't
quickly rebuild morale show that I'm
willing to support them fight back
anybody who wants to attack the people
and get the government and other people
who are critical at that point to
realize that these people want to solve
the problem of the company get the
company back up on on its legs and pay
back the government and so that's what
we were able to accomplish early on the
first three or four months
oh if tarp it expired and we didn't have
this exit plan I think we'd have been in
trouble I think people would have said
it looks like AIG you know even now
people headlines appear you know we're
not going to pay back the government
factors we are and they're going to get
a profit
but the main concern people have is
succession and for me I've already said
to the board and to the company and
employees that I would like to stay
around through this next year 2011 but
as we get into 2012 I'd like to think
about you know look I enjoyed my
retirement so and it's time for for the
company to not only for me to retire but
you should have a CEO who now has a 5 to
7 year horizon who can take us to the
next level and clearly that's not me but
more importantly I look back at my life
I've been blessed I've been incredible
life I've enjoyed my life in many ways
I've seen things that some people
wouldn't see in three lifetimes and so
when he headed up it's nice to know I'm
in a good place so I feel
psychologically fine I feel comfortable
it's just that I know that I probably
won't see 90 and I probably won't see
Eddie but but who knows how long the
future will be but none of us know that
and so you just enjoy and live every day
as much as your 10th
